UML can be used as much or as little as you like. Martin Fowler describes three common ways that people tend to use UML:
But UML modeling is not just about diagrams; it's about capturing your system as a model—the diagrams are actually just windows into that model.
Well, the first thing to understand is that your model sits behind your modeling tool and diagrams as a collection of elements.
diagram itself is not the model

Some projects can get away with less modeling. In fact, some commercial industries find that too much modeling is cumbersome and slows down productivity. For such projects, it makes sense to use UML as a sketch and have your model contain some architectural diagrams and a few class and sequence diagrams to illustrate
The problem with this method is that if a change in requirements occurs, the impact can be devastating.
